http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0058182/

@doritoman: Maximum I can upload (as single file) is 1.4 GB. It could be one fine 480p, rather than shitty 720p (which looks great on static scenes, but looked endlessly ugly near the end of "Troy" movie (night, battle,  lot of fires) and it always look as shit if bit-rate is too low. Well, on big-screens 480p cannot compete with nice 720p. But (and I repeat that as a parrot) - everything is in proper watching distance.
From 6-7 feet differences are hardly visible.

You have mentioned duration, but it is only a part of determining final size of the encode. It's more about content.
480p can stay below 1.4 GB, but I need one more night to encode.

If you are concerned about video quality so much and have no needs to compromise - I honestly think how getting one big-ass rip or even original disk is better solution.

twentyforty,  I know you like "Firefly," so I think you will enjoy this:

Programming Note: On November 11 at 10p, SCIENCE Channel reunites Joss Whedon, Nathan Fillion and the crew of the Serenity in Firefly: Browncoats Unite to offer a complete oral history of the franchise in a one-hour program.  Others joining in the reunion include Sean Maher, Summer Glau, Adam Baldwin, Morena Baccarin, Alan Tudyk, Gina Torres and Jewel Staite along with executive producer Tim Minear and executive story editor Jose Molina.  Prior to this primetime program, SCIENCE will air an all-day marathon of the Firefly series also on November 11 starting at 7a.

@supcena: Best way is to find specific torrent (maybe your torrent program make copies of downloaded torrents), open it and point to location (folder) is right now. I successfully seeded many old encodes from DVDR, USB stick or USB disk.

@acdc.rockz: I uploaded all episodes, but as you can see from my uploads (no TV show episodes last 45 days), not on TPB. Later I would make season pack for Hell on wheels on my site and maybe much later, on TPB. If you want, contact me on gmail mentioned above.
